intro: Esterhazya eitenorum, commonly known as the Eiten's ericoid, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
